noun.description: A number of bullets, arrows, or other projectiles discharged at one time.
examples: the infantry let off a couple of volleys

noun.description: (in sports, especially tennis or soccer) a strike or kick of the ball made before it touches the ground.

verb.description: (in sports, especially tennis or soccer) strike or kick (the ball) before it touches the ground.
examples: he took his chance well, volleying into the top corner from 25 yards

origin: Late 16th century: from French volée, based on Latin volare to fly.
